node_1: the bungalows hostel (then known as hostel cat)
edge: The Bungalows Hostel (then known as Hostel Cat) featured a facade built by the production team to appear as a wedding chapel in The Hangover.

The scene where Mr. Chow jumps out of the trunk of the Mercedes-Benz 220SE and assaults the protagonists with a crowbar was filmed adjacent to the Las Vegas Strip at the intersection of East Mandalay Bay Road and Haven Street, which remains a dirt lot.
Helms improvised a scene with the piano on the soundstage, which became known as 'Stu's song' in the film.
Mr. Chow assaults the protagonists with a crowbar in the scene filmed adjacent to the Las Vegas Strip.
Helms had to be tutored on how to use a piano for the 'Stu's song' scene in The Hangover.
The most difficult day of shooting was the scene where Mr. Chow rams his car and attacks the main characters, which required many takes and was very painful for Helms.
The missing tooth in Mr. Chow's character is not created with prosthetics or visual effects, but is naturally occurring due to Helms never having an adult incisor grow.
In the scene where Mr. Chow assaults the protagonists, Jeong jumped on Cooper's neck naked without it being a part of the script.
